Lack enough support: The claim that the Jafrabad shooter is Anurag Mishra lacks sufficient evidence or proof.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Jafrabad shooter was identified as Shahrukh and was arrested by the police.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the viral message on social media is accurate without verifying the information.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the photographs of Anurag D Mishra were misused and falsely attributed to the Jafrabad shooter.
Understate: The claim may understate the seriousness of the communal riots in Delhi by focusing on the identity of the shooter rather than the broader context of the violence.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough evidence or proof to support the assertion that the Jafrabad shooter is Anurag Mishra.
